TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit EventLogReader extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: Enables you to read events from an event log based on an event query. The events that are read by this object are returned as objects.

remarks.format: ## Examples For example code using this class, see [How To: Query for Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/5231a436-4cf2-4539-90d2-a04813aba069) or [How To: Access and Read Event Information](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/14db3375-d305-49ae-aa24-aedbe906e76c).

MemberSignature.Value: public EventLogReader (System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogQuery eventQuery);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogQuery eventQuery) cil managed

Docs.param: The event query used to retrieve events.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by specifying an event query.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogReader.ReadEvent%2A> method to retrieve events from this object.

MemberSignature.Value: public EventLogReader (string path);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string path) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the event log to retrieve events from.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by specifying an active event log to retrieve events from.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogReader.ReadEvent%2A> method to retrieve events from this object.

MemberSignature.Value: public EventLogReader (System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogQuery eventQuery, System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventBookmark bookmark);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogQuery eventQuery, class System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventBookmark bookmark) cil managed

Docs.param: The event query used to retrieve events.
The bookmark (placeholder) used as a starting position in the event log or stream of events. Only events logged after the bookmark event will be returned by the query.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by specifying an event query and a bookmark that is used as starting position for the query.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogReader.ReadEvent%2A> method to retrieve events from this object.

MemberSignature.Value: public EventLogReader (string path, System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.PathType pathType);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string path, valuetype System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.PathType pathType) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the event log to retrieve events from, or the path to the event log file to retrieve events from.
Specifies whether the string used in the path parameter specifies the name of an event log, or the path to an event log file.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by specifying the name of an event log to retrieve events from or the path to a log file to retrieve events from.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogReader.ReadEvent%2A> method to retrieve events from this object.

MemberSignature.Value: public int BatchSize { get; set; }
.property instance int32 BatchSize

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of events retrieved from the stream of events on every read operation.

Docs.summary: Releases all the resources used by this object.

.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose(bool disposing) cil managed

Docs.param: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.
Docs.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by this object, and optionally releases the managed resources.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Collections.Generic.IList<System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogStatus> LogStatus { get; }
.property instance class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogStatus> LogStatus

Docs.summary: Gets the status of each event log or log file associated with the event query in this object.
Docs.value: Returns a list of objects that each contain status information about an event log associated with the event query in this object.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventRecord ReadEvent ();
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventRecord ReadEvent() cil managed

Docs.summary: Reads the next event that is returned from the event query in this object.

remarks.format: ## Examples For example code using this class, see [How To: Query for Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/5231a436-4cf2-4539-90d2-a04813aba069).

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventRecord ReadEvent (TimeSpan timeout);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventRecord ReadEvent(valuetype System.TimeSpan timeout) cil managed

Docs.param: The maximum time to allow the read operation to run before canceling the operation.
Docs.summary: Reads the next event that is returned from the event query in this object.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Seek (System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventBookmark bookmark);
.method public hidebysig instance void Seek(class System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventBookmark bookmark) cil managed

Docs.param: The bookmark (placeholder) used as a starting position in the event log or stream of events. Only events that have been logged after the bookmark event will be returned by the query.
Docs.summary: Changes the position in the event stream where the next event that is read will come from by specifying a bookmark event. No events logged before the bookmark event will be retrieved.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can use this function only on result sets from an Admin or Operational channel, or from .evtx log files. This function is not supported on analytic and debug channels, or for ETL files.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Seek (System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventBookmark bookmark, long offset);
.method public hidebysig instance void Seek(class System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventBookmark bookmark, int64 offset) cil managed

Docs.param: The bookmark (placeholder) used as a starting position in the event log or stream of events. Only events that have been logged after the bookmark event will be returned by the query.
The offset number of events to change the position of the bookmark.
Docs.summary: Changes the position in the event stream where the next event that is read will come from by specifying a bookmark event and an offset number of events from the bookmark. No events logged before the bookmark plus the offset will be retrieved.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can use this function only on result sets from an Admin or Operational channel, or from .evtx log files. This function is not supported on analytic and debug channels, or for ETL files.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Seek (System.IO.SeekOrigin origin, long offset);
.method public hidebysig instance void Seek(valuetype System.IO.SeekOrigin origin, int64 offset) cil managed

Docs.param: A value from the enumeration defines where in the stream of events to start querying for events.
The offset number of events to add to the origin.
Docs.summary: Changes the position in the event stream where the next event that is read will come from by specifying a starting position and an offset from the starting position. No events logged before the starting position plus the offset will be retrieved.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can use this function only on result sets from an Admin or Operational channel, or from .evtx log files. This function is not supported on analytic and debug channels, or for ETL files.
